messages.author: Peter Kasting
messages.text:
Nit: I'd put the declaration and definition one after the other within the same "// -----" section; call that section by the name of the class; and put that section just after any sections of file-scope functions.

(I'd also put sections for other classes (e.g. member classes) completely above or below the section for URLIndexPrivateData, and have that class only have one section, called by the name of the class.  I'd also put two blank lines above each section divider comment rather than one.)

messages.author: Peter Kasting
messages.text: Nit: Maybe remove the slash?  I'm not sure what the sentence means with it in there.

messages.author: Peter Kasting
messages.text: Nit: I suggest using a pointer instead of a non-const ref, just because non-const refs are so rare in Google code

messages.author: Mark P
messages.text:
On 2013/03/01 22:13:39, Peter Kasting wrote:
> Nit: I'd put the declaration and definition one after the other within the same
> "// -----" section; call that section by the name of the class; and put that
> section just after any sections of file-scope functions.

Done, put the helper class just below the algorithm functions section and just above the constructor for the first class declared in the .h  Also moved the implementation to this area as well.

> 
> (I'd also put sections for other classes (e.g. member classes) completely above
> or below the section for URLIndexPrivateData,

Moved below.  I'm sorry this cut-and-paste is going to cause what looks like a large diff in the code review tool.

> and have that class only have one
> section, called by the name of the class.

Done.

> I'd also put two blank lines above
> each section divider comment rather than one.)

Done.

messages.author: Mark P

Done.

with
updated

messages.author: Peter Kasting
messages.text: I don't understand why this is needed.  VisitInfo is already typedefed to pair<Time, PageTransition>.  Can't you use that?

messages.author: Mark P
messages.text:
On 2013/03/01 22:13:39, Peter Kasting wrote:
> I don't understand why this is needed.  VisitInfo is already typedefed to
> pair<Time, PageTransition>.  Can't you use that?

Somehow I missed that.  Done; I now use that.

messages.author: Peter Kasting
messages.text: "likely" seems like a strong word; won't this be correct most of the time, but incorrect for a brief period after visiting the URL?

messages.author: Mark P
messages.text:
On 2013/03/01 22:13:39, Peter Kasting wrote:
> "likely" seems like a strong word; won't this be correct most of the time, but
> incorrect for a brief period after visiting the URL?

Revised comment.

message: compiles chrome; didn't check unit_tests. Also missing cache recording.
